skill.name: file-organizer
skill.description: Intelligently organizes your files and folders across your computer by understanding context, finding duplicates, suggesting better structures, and automating cleanup tasks. Reduces cognitive load and keeps your digital workspace tidy without manual effort.
skill.summary: Intelligently organizes your files and folders across your computer by understanding context, findin...
skill.author: DYAI2025

security_audit.summary: All 74 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a prompt-based documentation file containing file organization instructions using standard Unix commands. The static analyzer misinterpreted markdown syntax and metadata fields as security issues. MD5 hashing is used for duplicate file detection (not cryptography). Backticks are markdown code block delimiters, not shell execution. No executable code, network calls, or credential access.

content.value_statement: Disorganized files waste time and cause stress. This skill analyzes your directories, identifies duplicates, and creates logical folder structures. It handles the cognitive load of organization so you can focus on your work.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes folder structures and file distributions across directories
Finds duplicate files using hash comparisons and size analysis
Suggests logical folder organization based on file types and content
Creates new folder structures with user approval before changes
Moves and renames files systematically with clear logging
Identifies old files for archival based on modification dates
limitations: Requires user confirmation before moving or deleting any files
Operates only within directories the user explicitly specifies
Does not access cloud storage services or networked drives
Cannot recover files after deletion without backup

use_cases.title: Clean Up Downloads
use_cases.description: Sort a chaotic Downloads folder into organized categories like Work, Personal, Installers, and Archive.

use_cases.title: Restructure Projects
use_cases.description: Review and reorganize project directories by separating active work from archived projects.

use_cases.title: Find Duplicates
use_cases.description: Identify and remove duplicate files wasting space across Documents and other folders.

prompt_templates.title: Quick Downloads Cleanup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me organize my Downloads folder. Clean up duplicates, sort files by type, and archive anything older than 3 months.

prompt_templates.title: Find Duplicates
prompt_templates.prompt: Find duplicate files in my Documents folder. Show me each duplicate set and help me decide which to keep.

prompt_templates.title: Review Project Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my ~/Projects directory. Identify organization issues, suggest a better structure, and move archived projects to an Archive folder.

prompt_templates.title: Monthly Maintenance
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a monthly cleanup on my files. Find files not touched in 6 months, identify duplicates, and suggest what can be archived or removed.

output: Found 487 files across 23 folders totaling 4.2 GB
File types: 156 images, 89 PDFs, 67 installers, 45 documents, 130 miscellaneous
Suggested structure: Work/, Personal/, Installers/, Archive/, ToSort/
Action required: Please confirm you want to proceed with the proposed organization.

output_examples.input: Find duplicate files in my Documents
output: Found 23 sets of duplicates (156 MB total)
Recommendation: Keep the most recent version in the correct location
Ready to review the next duplicate set?
Analysis complete: 45 projects found, 12 inactive for 2+ years
Proposed structure: Active/, Archive/ (by year), Templates/

best_practices: Always specify the exact directory you want organized to avoid accidental changes to unrelated files
Review the proposed organization plan carefully before giving approval to move or delete anything
Run regular maintenance on high-turnover folders like Downloads to prevent future clutter buildup
anti_patterns: Asking to organize your entire home directory without specifying scope
Approving file moves without reviewing the proposed plan first
Using this skill on directories containing active project work without creating a backup

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex. All provide similar file management capabilities.

faq.question: How many files can it organize?
faq.answer: There is no fixed limit. Performance depends on your system resources. Very large directories with 100,000+ files may take longer to process.

faq.question: Does it integrate with cloud storage?
faq.answer: This skill operates on local directories only. Cloud services like Dropbox or Google Drive must be accessed through their local sync folders.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill requires your confirmation before moving or deleting any files. It never accesses sensitive directories without your explicit permission.

faq.question: What if something goes wrong?
faq.answer: The skill logs all file moves. If needed, you can manually restore files from your trash or backup. Always confirm before deleting duplicates.

faq.question: How is this different from built-in tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered context awareness. It understands file relationships and suggests logical organization based on content, not just file type sorting.
